poem:
Title: "A Protest in Sprayed Stanzas"

In Brussels, the laden shelves once teemed,
Now echo hollow, left unfilled and grimed.
EU plays politics it seems,
Diluted targets, nature's truths undermined.

Farmers' rebellion, red tape and all, 
Across Italian fields, their discontent sprawls.
Pesticide promises, regulations fall,
Whispers of revolt, through Parliament halls.

Still, as dawn breaks, the rooster crows,
A spray of hope in stanzas sows.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "EU waters down pollution targets and will seek to weaken pesticide regulations in bid to quell farmers’ protests – Europe live 11.50am GMT The impact of farmers’ protests can be felt at a Brussels supermarket, where products are missing. Effect of farmers protests and road blockages still being felt in Brussels pic.twitter.com/WEkKCaCE89— Lisa O'Carroll (@lisaocarroll) February 6, 2024 11.47am GMT Italian farmers protest red tape and cheap imports Italian farmers, protesting about red tape and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
